hero.title: Software Developer
hero.description: Passionate about technology, specialized in Frontend Development.
data: My activities are quite diverse. I work on creating applications, both for web and mobile.

For each project, I strive to use best practices and gain new insights. In addition to writing code, I also participate in requirements analysis, implementation, and maintenance of applications (well, I don't just deal with the frontend, haha).

Currently, I am focused on my personal and professional development, always looking to learn new technologies and enhance my skills. Additionally, I have a strong interest in helping others enter the world of software development. To this end, I write articles sharing my knowledge, experiences, and practical tips for those who are starting out or already have some experience in the field.
Although I have some preferred tools, I always try to choose the best tool for the job, even if itâ€™s not on my usual list. My goal is to find the right solution for each project.

work.title: Frontend Developer
work.description: As a Frontend Developer at ETIC, I create intuitive and engaging digital experiences using modern technologies. My expertise includes:
list: Updated technologies and frontend frameworks, such as React.js and Next.js

work.title: Fullstack Developer
work.description: As a Fullstack Developer at Novagrolider, I had the following responsibilities:
list: Frontend: developed dynamic interfaces with React.js, created mobile applications with React Native, and applied Tailwind CSS, Bootstrap, and CSS for responsive and advanced styling; built desktop applications using C# WinForm.
Backend: developed fast and efficient APIs with Node.js (Express and Fastify), built scalable web services with C# and .NET Core, and implemented communication between services using WCF.
Versioning and Collaboration: used Git for version control and collaboration.
Packaging and Distribution: facilitated application distribution with Docker.

projects.description: Throughout my career as a developer, I have worked on many projects. Many are open source, so feel free to explore the code and contribute your own improvements.
